content:
The Boston Globe has collaborated with other news agencies, organizations, and individuals in several ways to further its mission and reach. Some examples include:

1. Pulitzer Center on Crisis Reporting: The Boston Globe partnered with the Pulitzer Center on Crisis Reporting to produce a multimedia project on the global water crisis.

2. ProPublica: The Boston Globe collaborated with ProPublica to investigate the rise of distracted driving and its impact on road safety.

3. Facebook Journalism Project: The Boston Globe joined the Facebook Journalism Project to promote reliable and trustworthy journalism on social media.

4. Boston University's New England Center for Investigative Reporting: The Boston Globe partnered with Boston University's New England Center for Investigative Reporting to produce in-depth investigative stories on a range of topics.

5. Other news organizations: The Boston Globe has partnered with other news organizations, such as NPR and WGBH, to produce and distribute content.

6. Individual journalists: The Boston Globe has hired individual journalists who bring unique expertise and perspectives to the paper, such as Wesley Lowery, who covers race and policing, and Liz Goodwin, who covers national politics.

Through these collaborations, The Boston Globe has been able to produce high-quality journalism, expand its reach, and engage with new audiences.
